name: Sun
additional_info: The Sun, also known as 'The King', is the central star of the Solar System. The Sun's mass accounts for about 99.86% of the total mass of the Solar System.
structure: About three-quarters of the Sun's mass is hydrogen, with the remainder primarily helium. Only 1.69% of the Sun's mass (still 5,630 times the mass of Earth) is made up of heavier elements like carbon, iron, neon, and oxygen.
distance: The average distance from Earth to the Sun is about 149.6 million km (1 astronomical unit). On average, sunlight takes about 8 minutes and 19 seconds to reach Earth.
in_milky_way: Once thought to be a relatively insignificant star, the Sun is now considered brighter than about 85% of the stars in the Milky Way galaxy. The Sun's home address lies about two-thirds of the way from the center of the Milky Way.

name: Earth
additional_info: Earth is the only known planet in the Solar System with life.
structure: Earth's atmosphere is mainly composed of nitrogen and oxygen, along with small amounts of other gases like argon and carbon dioxide. About 71% of Earth's surface is covered by water, with the oceans holding 97.5% of Earth's total water.
distance: The average distance from Earth to the Sun is about 149.6 million km (1 astronomical unit).
in_milky_way: Earth lies in the Milky Way galaxy, in the Orion arm, about 26,000 light-years from the galactic center.

name: Moon
additional_info: The Moon is Earth's only natural satellite and the fifth-largest satellite in the Solar System.
structure: The Moon's surface is covered with thousands of impact craters from meteorite collisions.
distance: The average distance from Earth to the Moon is about 384,400 km.
in_milky_way: The Moon, along with Earth, is located in the Milky Way galaxy in the Orion arm.

name: Mercury
description: The planet closest to the Sun
additional_info: Mercury is the smallest planet in the Solar System and the closest to the Sun.
structure: Mercury's surface is covered with many impact craters and vast flat regions.
distance: The average distance from Mercury to the Sun is about 57.9 million km.
in_milky_way: Mercury is located in the Solar System, in the Orion arm of the Milky Way galaxy.

name: Saturn
description: The planet with the prominent rings
additional_info: Saturn is famous for its extensive ring system, which consists of ice and rock.
structure: Saturn's rings are made up of small ice and rock particles and extend thousands of kilometers.
distance: The average distance from Saturn to the Sun is about 1.4 billion km.
in_milky_way: Saturn is located in the Solar System, in the Orion arm of the Milky Way galaxy.

name: Mars
additional_info: Mars' surface is covered with red dust due to iron oxide, and it is believed to have had liquid water in the past.
structure: Mars' thin atmosphere is mostly carbon dioxide, with traces of argon and nitrogen.
distance: The average distance from Mars to the Sun is about 227.9 million km.
in_milky_way: Mars is located in the Solar System, in the Orion arm of the Milky Way galaxy.

name: Jupiter
additional_info: Jupiter is the largest planet in the Solar System, known for its 'Great Red Spot' storm that has been raging for centuries.
structure: Jupiter's 'Great Red Spot' is a giant storm, three times the size of Earth, and has existed for hundreds of years.
distance: The average distance from Jupiter to the Sun is about 778.5 million km.
in_milky_way: Jupiter is located in the Solar System, in the Orion arm of the Milky Way galaxy.

name: Uranus
additional_info: Uranus has a tilted axis, nearly lying horizontally compared to its orbital plane.
structure: Uranus' axial tilt is about 98 degrees, causing it to almost rotate on its side.
distance: The average distance from Uranus to the Sun is about 2.9 billion km.
in_milky_way: Uranus is located in the Solar System, in the Orion arm of the Milky Way galaxy.

name: Neptune
additional_info: Neptune is the farthest planet from the Sun and has a dynamic and active atmosphere.
structure: Neptune is known for its strong winds and storms, including the Great Dark Spot, which was discovered by Voyager 2.
distance: The average distance from Neptune to the Sun is about 4.5 billion km.
in_milky_way: Neptune is located in the Solar System, in the Orion arm of the Milky Way galaxy.

name: Venus
description: The Morning Star or Evening Star
additional_info: Venus is the hottest planet in the Solar System, with its thick atmosphere causing an extreme greenhouse effect.
structure: The atmosphere of Venus is extremely thick, composed mainly of carbon dioxide, creating an intense greenhouse effect. The surface is covered with numerous volcanoes and tectonic activity.
distance: The average distance from Venus to the Sun is about 108 million km.
in_milky_way: Venus is located in the Solar System, in the Orion arm of the Milky Way galaxy.
